headline: How Every House Member Voted on the G.O.P. Megabill
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The House voted 215 to 214 to pass the domestic policy bill that will deliver President Trump’s domestic agenda.

headline: How every House member voted on Trump’s big budget bill
description: The One Big Beautiful Bill contains many parts of President Donald Trump’s tax and immigration agenda. See how your lawmaker voted.

headline: Was Your Home Damaged by the L.A. Fires? We Want to Hear About Your Home Insurance Claim.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Share your story with us.

headline: How Trump Has Targeted New Groups for Deportation
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Trump administration has made drastic changes to immigration policy to drive up deportation numbers. Here is an overview of recent actions and the people they affect.

headline: U.S. Debt Is on Pace to Set a Record High, Going All the Way Back to 1790
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: If Republicans pass their tax and spending megabill, the record will arrive even sooner — putting America’s debt at more than 113 percent of the size of its entire economy.

headline: You asked: Are vaccines approved without safety studies?
description: No, this is not true. Vaccines undergo rigorous safety testing and are continuously monitored for adverse events.

headline: The fate of Trump’s agenda rests with the House GOP’s ‘five families’
description: They call themselves the ‘five families.’ This week will test whether the House GOP’s factions can come together to advance Trump’s big bill.

headline: Audio Data Shows Newark Outage Problems Persisted Longer Than Officials Said
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Times analysis of air traffic recordings and flight data shows that outage-related problems persisted far longer than what the officials have acknowledged.

headline: Where local forecast offices no longer monitor weather around-the-clock
description: For at least half a century, the National Weather Service has been an around-the-clock operation. That is no longer possible in parts of the country.

headline: The top 25 WNBA players for the 2025 season
description: Another WNBA season begins Friday. Our list ranks the league’s best players.

headline: The Global Happiness Curve Is Collapsing. What Does That Mean?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/video/
description: For decades, research showed that the way people experienced happiness across their lifetimes looked like a U-shaped curve: Happiness tended to be high when they were young, then dipped in midlife, only to rise again as they grew old. But recent surveys suggest that curve is starting to flatten. Christina Caron, a Well reporter, explains.

headline: The Major Supreme Court Decisions in 2025
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: In a term that was increasingly overshadowed by emergency requests related to President Trump’s swift executive actions, justices heard arguments on transgender rights, the role of religion in public life, gun violence and speech online.

headline: Let’s chat about RFK Jr. and vaccines. Send us your questions.
description: Post health reporters will answer your questions on Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s plans for public health during a live chat at 10 a.m. ET on Friday.

headline: Indian strikes on Pakistan damaged six airfields, Post analysis finds
description: A review of satellite images and aftermath videos found that the strikes damaged three hangars, two runways and a pair of mobile buildings used by the air force.

headline: You’re probably eating more sugar than you think. Try our quiz to find out.
description: Take our quiz to test your knowledge. The answers might surprise you.

headline: 185% Tariffs: How the Trade War Hit One Shipment of T-Shirts
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Even with a temporary reprieve, tariffs have begun to squeeze importers. See how.

headline: Chosen one: a visual guide to Pope Leo XIV, leader of the world's 1.4 billion Catholics
label: https://www.scmp.com/world/
description: Explore our infographic on Leo XIV, the first American pope, and how he was elected as leader of the Catholic Church.

headline: Summer could be about to get a lot more expensive, thanks to tariffs
description: China produces many American summer essentials — from swimsuits and flip-flops to beach shades to grills — and this weekend’s trade talks might not avert price rises.

headline: At least two Indian jets appear to have crashed during Pakistan strikes, visuals show
description: In a review of visuals posted online, The Post verified debris consistent with at least two French-made fighter jets flown by the Indian air force.

headline: The Biggest Medicaid Cut Left for House Republicans Would Hit Red States Hardest
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: Now, Trump’s big budget bill might require particularly painful cuts in the South.

headline: See How a Communications Outage Affected Flights at Newark Airport
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The effects of an interruption in radio and radar service could be seen almost immediately, as planes circled in holding patterns. They are still being felt in cancellations and major delays days later.

headline: Are you more likely to die on your birthday?
description: No description available

headline: Silicon Valley Is Coming for the Pentagon’s $1 Trillion Budget
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: The Trump administration wants startups to remake the US military, setting the stage for a battle over the world’s biggest defense budget.

headline: What’s in a name? The meaning and history behind choosing a papal name.
description: When the conclave is over and cardinals choose a pope, the new pontiff will be introduced by his papal name. Popular names include John, Gregory and Benedict.

headline: Trump Has Been Stopped By Courts More Than 200 Times
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Hundreds of court battles challenging Donald Trump's executive actions are a stress test on the balance of power at the heart of American democracy.

headline: AI Is Draining Water From the Areas That Need It Most
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: More than 160 new AI data centers have been built across the US in the past three years in regions already grappling with scarce water resources, a Bloomberg News analysis finds.

headline: Land under the country’s largest cities is sinking. Here’s where — and why.
description: The movement is slow — sinking on the scale of millimeters per year in the United States — but the effects accumulate over years.

headline: How Long Will the Conclave Take?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: There is no formal time limit for cardinals to elect a pope. Past papal selections have lasted from a few hours to three years.

headline: The Huge, Under-the-Radar Shift Happening in the West Bank
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: Over the past few months, an Israeli military operation has displaced tens of thousands of Palestinians in West Bank cities. Some Palestinians fear it may be laying the ground to annex the territory.

headline: Top Trump Crypto Buyers Vying for Dinner Seats Are Likely Foreign, Data Shows
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: The majority of top holders of Donald Trump’s memecoin have used foreign exchanges that say they ban US users, suggesting many purchasers are based abroad

headline: Is there a new pope?
description: Cardinals of the Catholic Church are gathering in the Sistine Chapel to elect a new pope. Here’s what the smoke signals indicate so far.

headline: What Makes This Conclave Unpredictable
label: https://www.nytimes.com/video/
description: A diverse electorate of cardinals is meeting in a conclave to pick the next pope. Though Francis appointed most of them, they may not choose another pope like him, as Jason Horowitz, the Rome bureau chief of The New York Times, explains.

headline: Chinese Imports Hit 2-Decade Low as Trump Tariffs Begin to Bite
label: https://www.nytimes.com/business/
description: While imports can swing with seasonal shifts, President Trump’s ratcheting up of U.S. tariffs on China has begun to cascade through supply chains, government data shows.

headline: See Who Your Neighborhood Is Funding in New York City’s Mayoral Race
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Former Gov. Andrew Cuomo is the current front-runner but Zohran Mamdani has gotten more donations from individuals than any other candidate.

headline: G.O.P. Targets a Medicaid Loophole Used by 49 States to Grab Federal Money
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: States have long used taxes on hospitals and nursing homes to increase federal matching funds. If Republicans end the tactic, red states could feel the most pain.

headline: The Church Is More Global Than Ever. What Does That Mean for the Next Pope?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Francis appointed most of the cardinals. But they may not choose another pope like him.

headline: Inside Starbase, Elon Musk’s New City
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: On Saturday, local residents who mostly work for Elon Musk’s rocket company voted to create an official city for themselves: Starbase, Texas.

headline: 10-Minute Challenge: ‘The Starry Night’ by van Gogh
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

headline: Dozens killed in U.S. strike on purported detention center in Yemen, visuals show
description: The compound includes a migrant detention center and has at times served military functions, according to U.N. and human rights researchers.

headline: The Deep Budget Cuts Trump Seeks as His Second Term Takes Shape
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: No description available

headline: How Trump has reshaped U.S. foreign policy in his first 100 days
description: Trump’s first 100 days have been marked by a reevaluation of traditional alliances and a reshaping of the global economic order.

headline: Trump Proposes $163 Billion in Cuts Across Government in New Budget
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: Many of the suggested cuts, which would require congressional approval, target federal programs that benefit the poor.

headline: Thousands of Falling Satellites Put the Atmosphere at Risk
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: No description available

headline: The Rising Cost of ICE Flying Immigrants to Far-Flung Detention Centers
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: The increase in long-distance transfers makes it harder to fight deportation and boosts taxpayer expense.

headline: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs’s tangled network of allegations, lawsuits
description: Explore The Washington Post’s interactive database of the dozens of sexual assault lawsuits filed against Sean “Diddy” Combs.

headline: Israel redraws Gaza map, limiting Palestinians to a third of the enclave
description: Since breaking the ceasefire, Israeli forces have declared about 70 percent of Gaza either as a military “red zone” or under evacuation.

headline: Here’s how GDP shows tariffs are starting to take a toll
description: Few pieces of the first-quarter GDP report remained untouched by the Trump administration’s tariff policy.

headline: Are Trump’s Actions Truly Unprecedented? We Asked 35 Historians.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We categorized 22 of Mr. Trump’s actions, ranging from those that have no comparable historical example to those that do.

headline: Where Federal Dollars Flow to Universities Around the Country
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Trump administration has targeted a few elite universities with its threats to freeze funding. But many more schools around the country are vulnerable.

headline: Hour by Hour: How Trump Deported Migrants Despite Judge’s Order
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The move exposed a quietly orchestrated deal between the president and El Salvador, culminating in a back-and-forth with a U.S. federal judge over the course of one frenetic day.

headline: Inside the conclave: A visual guide on how the next pope will be elected
description: The conclave process to elect the next pope is shrouded in secrecy. Here’s a visual guide to the ancient tradition.

headline: Has International Travel to the U.S. Really Collapsed?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Despite some ominous signs, a close look at the data shows that travel to the United States is largely holding up — at least so far.

headline: Trump’s Astonishing 100 Days, in 8 Charts
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: By many measures, the opening months of President Trump’s second term stand apart from those of essentially any modern president.

headline: Cause of Spain power outage still unclear after mass blackout, travel chaos
description: Red Eléctrica, Spain’s electricity grid operator, ruled out a cyberattack, human error or unusual weather. Experts say it could take weeks to determine the cause.

headline: Trump’s first 100 days, in 10 charts
description: Trump’s second term has seen a significant increase in executive orders, with more than 140 signed in his first 100 days, and a decline in his approval rating.

headline: 2025 Canada Federal Election Live Results: Liberals Win
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Canadians are heading to the polls today to elect their members of Parliament. First polls close at 7 p.m. Eastern.

headline: Your Home Without China
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We analyzed import data to show where Americans may see product shortages, fewer choices and price increases.

headline: ICE Arrests Nearly 800 in Florida in Operation With Local Officers
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: The four-day operation came as the Trump administration has sought to enlist local authorities in an immigration crackdown.

headline: See Who Attended Pope Francis’ Funeral
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Explore a photo of world leaders who were at the funeral.

headline: DOGE's cuts are nowhere near what Elon Musk promised
description: In October, Elon Musk said he would cut government spending by $2 trillion. Now, he says it's closer to $150 billion — less than 8 percent of what he promised.

headline: U.S. autism data project sparks uproar over ethics, privacy and intent
description: Administration health officials walked back a plan to register people with autism after criticism from scientists, privacy experts and advocates for people with autism.

headline: Mangione pleads not guilty to federal charges in killing of health-care CEO
description: Luigi Mangione was arraigned in federal court on four charges, including murder through use of a firearm, under which he is eligible for capital punishment.

headline: Top Colleges Are Too Costly Even for Parents Making $300,000
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Many families earn too much to get meaningful aid but too little to cover tuition out of pocket

headline: Canada Election Live Results 2025
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Track Canada's electoral seats, districts, and key battlegrounds in real time

headline: Meet the top donors to Trump’s $239 million inauguration fund
description: The donors who gave at least $1 million to President Donald Trump’s 2025 inauguration fund include crypto companies and people appointed to his administration.

headline: Así ataca el sarampión a un niño sin vacunar
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/
description: Con la caída de las tasas de vacunación y los brotes que han causado más de 790 casos en Estados Unidos y al menos dos muertes, los expertos en salud esperan que cientos o incluso miles más se contagien en los próximos meses.

headline: In hot water: CK Hutchison’s ports deal risks being dunked
label: https://www.scmp.com/hong_kong/
description: Hong Kong-based conglomerate CK Hutchison Holdings dropped a bombshell in March by announcing that it was selling all its overseas ports

headline: Which cities have the most trees? See how yours stacks up.
description: Why some U.S. cities are so much greener than others
